00001 <h2>Instructions</h2>
00002 <p>
00003         Drop WebSMS in the Library/Widgets folder in your Home.
00004         Open Dashboard, click on the + button to show the widget bar,
00005         drag WebSMS on the screen and enjoy!
00006 </p>
00007 <p>
00008         Safari users will be prompted to automatically install and open
00009         the widget after downloading.
00010 </p>

00068 <h3 id="websms">WebSMS</h3>
00069 <p class="centered">
00070         <img src="/assets/images/software/widgets/websms/websms_front-1.4.png" alt="WebSMS interface" />
00071 </p>
00072 <p>
00073         WebSMS widget represents a small cellular phone, with a big screen
00074         and three buttons. The central one sends the message and performs some other
00075         actions, the left button launches the web browser to this guide and the right
00076         one flips the widget to show the back configuration pane.
00077 </p>
00078 
00079 <h3>Configuration</h3>
00080 <h4 id="call_settings">Call settings</h4>
00081 <p class="centered">
00082         <img src="/assets/images/software/widgets/websms/websms_preferences-call.png" alt="WebSMS call preferences" />
00083 </p>
00084 <p>
00085         Before using WebSMS, you&rsquo;ll have to enter the username and password to
00086         access your provider&rsquo;s service.
00087         You can use the <b>sign</b> field to append a signature to every message
00088         you send (actual support depends on plugin implementations).
00089 </p>
00090 <p>
00091         You can insert the recipient&rsquo;s phone number either directly, or choosing
00092         it from a dropdown menu. Contacts are retrieved from those featuring a mobile
00093         phone number in the Address Book.
00094 </p>
00095 <h4 id="network_settings">Network settings</h4>
00096 <p class="centered">
00097         <img src="/assets/images/software/widgets/websms/websms_preferences-network.png" alt="WebSMS network preferences" />
00098 </p>
00099 <p>
00100         If you are behind a proxy, you will have to inform WebSMS of that. Here you
00101         can fill the proxy type, host name and port, authentication keys and scheme.
00102         If you don&rsquo;t know what a proxy is, you&rsquo;d have to leave those fields
00103         blank
00104 </p>
00105 <h4 id="appearance_settings">Appearance settings</h4>
00106 <p class="centered">
00107         <img src="/assets/images/software/widgets/websms/websms_preferences-appearance.png" alt="WebSMS appearance preferences" />
00108 </p>
00109 <p>
00110         Customize every instance of WebSMS with a different color, one for each of
00111         your friends!
00112 </p>
00113 <h4 id="international_settings">International settings</h4>
00114 <p class="centered">
00115         <img src="/assets/images/software/widgets/websms/websms_preferences-international.png" alt="WebSMS international preferences" />
00116 </p>
00117 <p>
00118         Choose your country. The country code will be used to filter services not available
00119         in your country and to provide a country code to those services that require one.
00120 </p>
00121 <h4 id="su_settings">Software Update settings</h4>
00122 <p class="centered">
00123         <img src="/assets/images/software/widgets/websms/websms_preferences-software-update.png" alt="WebSMS software update preferences" />
00124 </p>
00125 <p>
00126         Tracking software updates is always a pain in the a** (not to mention development!).
00127         This panel lets you find available updates for the installed plugins. Click <strong>Check</strong>
00128         to retrieve a list of the newest plugins, choose the ones
00129         you&rsquo;d like to update, then click <strong>Update</strong>.
00130         They will be downloaded, replaced and automatically loaded for immediate use.
00131 </p>
00132 <h3 id="composing">Composing</h3>
00133 <p class="centered">
00134         <img src="/assets/images/software/widgets/websms/websms_compose-1.4.png" alt="Message composing" />
00135 </p>
00136 <p>
00137         Write your message. You&rsquo;ll see how many available characters are left in
00138         the upper right corner of the screen. Warning: some characters may be garbled
00139         during transfer. At the moment, WebSMS doesn&rsquo;t perform any validation of
00140         the message.
00141 </p>
00142 
00143 <h3 id="translation">Translation</h3>
00144 <p class="centered">
00145         <img src="/assets/images/software/widgets/websms/websms_translate.png" alt="Automatic message translation" />
00146 </p>
00147 <p>
00148         Thanks to
00149         <a href="http://code.google.com/apis/ajaxlanguage/" class="external">Google Ajax Language API</a>,
00150         WebSMS can automatically translate your message to another language.
00151 </p>
00152 <p>
00153         Source language detection is transparently handled for you by the Language API.
00154         How cool is that?
00155         You just have to press <strong>Command+Option+Control+<em>&lt;Key&gt;</em></strong>,
00156         where <em>&lt;Key&gt;</em> is one of the letters below:
00157 </p>
00158 <div class="centered">
00159         <table width="100%" summary="List of keys for supported languages">
00160                 <tr>
00161                         <th>Key</th>
00162                         <th>Language</th>
00163                         <th>Key</th>
00164                         <th>Language</th>
00165                 </tr>
00166                 <tr>
00167                         <td>A</td>
00168                         <td>Arabic</td>
00169                         <td>K</td>
00170                         <td>Korean</td>
00171                 </tr>
00172                 <tr>
00173                         <td>D</td>
00174                         <td>German</th>
00175                         <td>N</td>
00176                         <td>Dutch</td>
00177                 </tr>
00178                 <tr>
00179                         <td>E</td>
00180                         <td>English</td>
00181                         <td>P</td>
00182                         <td>Portuguese</td>
00183                 </tr>
00184                 <tr>
00185                         <td>F</td>
00186                         <td>French</td>
00187                         <td>R</td>
00188                         <td>Russian</td>
00189                 </tr>
00190                 <tr>
00191                         <td>I</td>
00192                         <td>Italian</td>
00193                         <td>S</td>
00194                         <td>Spanish</td>
00195                 </tr>
00196                 <tr>
00197                         <td>J</td>
00198                         <td>Japanese</td>
00199                         <td>Z</td>
00200                         <td>Chinese</td>
00201                 </tr>
00202         </table>
00203 </div>
00204 <p>
00205         <em><strong>Warning:</strong> not all the language pairs allow direct translation. You may have
00206         to translate to English first, then to the desired language.</em>
00207 </p>
00208 
00209 <h3 id="sending">Sending</h3>
00210 <p class="centered">
00211         <img src="/assets/images/software/widgets/websms/websms_send-1.4.png" alt="Message sending" />
00212 </p>
00213 <p>
00214   When you&rsquo;ve finished composing, press the center button to send the message.
00215   An indicator on the upper left corner of the screen means the widget is sending
00216   your message.
00217 </p>
00218 
00219 <h3 id="confirmation">Confirmation</h3>
00220 <p class="centered">
00221         <img src="/assets/images/software/widgets/websms/websms-captcha.png" alt="Entering a confirmation code" />
00222 </p>
00223 <p>
00224         Some services require the user to enter a visual code for confirmation 
00225         (<?php Wikipedia::lookup('Captcha'); ?>).
00226         WebSMS presents you the code when required. After entering it, you just have to
00227         press <strong>Enter</strong>, or press the send button again.
00228 </p>
00229 
00230 <h3 id="faq"><acronym title="Frequently Asked Questions">FAQ</acronym></h3>
00231 
00232 <p class="faq-question">
00233   Q: What should I put as username and password to use the plugin for service XYZ?
00234 </p>
00235 <p class="faq-answer">
00236   A: Username and password are usually the same you would use with your service
00237   to access your user account from your web browser. Please refer to your service
00238   documentation to learn more.
00239 </p>
00240 
00241 <p class="faq-question">
00242   Q: How much does it cost??
00243 </p>
00244 <p class="faq-answer">
00245   A: Nothing. The widget is free software, but if you&rsquo;d like to, I&rsquo;d be glad to
00246   <?php echo $this->link_to('accept donations', array('controller' => 'donate')); ?>.
00247 </p>
00248 
00249 <p class="faq-question">
00250   Q: How much does it cost sending messages with WebSMS?
00251 </p>
00252 <p class="faq-answer">
00253   A: Nothing. At the moment, WebSMS is using free sending services only.
00254 </p>
00255 
00256 <p class="faq-question">
00257   Q: I&rsquo;m not Italian. WebSMS is useless to me.
00258 </p>
00259 <p class="faq-answer">
00260   A: I&rsquo;m sorry, but since WebSMS is a volunteer effort, I cannot write plugins
00261   for carriers outside Italy. If you or someone you know would like to contribute
00262   to the project, please refer to the source code available for download. It contains
00263   a commented example plugin template, so you can easily create your own.
00264 </p>
00265 
00266 <p class="faq-question">
00267   Q: What does WebSMS do with my own data? Is it secure?
00268 </p>
00269 <p class="faq-answer">
00270   A: Your data, username and password will be used only to access your carrier&rsquo;s
00271   website and perform the sending. WebSMS will NEVER disclose those informations to any
00272   third party.
00273 </p>
00274 
00275 <p class="faq-question">
00276   Q: I&rsquo;d like to send SMS with my carrier, but WebSMS doesn&rsquo;t support it.
00277 </p>
00278 <p class="faq-answer">
00279   A: If you&rsquo;re a developer, and you know Javascript, HTML and HTTP, you could write it
00280   on your own. Otherwise, write me and I&rsquo;ll try my best to do it.
00281   Remember that some services require a paid subscription or some device (decoder, modem) to
00282   be accessed, though.
00283 </p>
00284 
00285 <p class="faq-question">
00286   Q: I&rsquo;m $famous_phone_carrier and I&rsquo;d like to support WebSMS, can you make a branded version for me??
00287 </p>
00288 <p class="faq-answer">
00289   A: Heck, yes!
00290   <?php echo $this->link_to('Let&rsquo;s talk about it!', array('controller' => 'contact')); ?>.
00291 </p>
